abstract: This is the first film in Gillian Armstrong's documentary series chronicling the lives of three young girls in South Australia. They talk openly about their attitudes to their parents, sex and boys, pregnancy, marriage and their careers.
description: First film in a longitudinal study of three Adelaide girls, aged thirteen and fourteen. They talk about their attitudes to sex and boys, pregnancy, abortion, marriage, school, parenthood and their careers. Their hopes and ambitions pose special questions for adults and young people alike. Edited by David Pulbrook; sound by Rod Pascoe and photographed by Tom Cowan.
